results.title: The Making of Star Wars: as told by C-3PO and R2-D2
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Robert Guenette
results.brief_description: Star Wars is undoubtedly one of the most popular films ever made. Two characters from the film, C-3P0 and R2-D2 lead the viewer on a fascinating behind the scenes look at how the movie was made. Secrets of the special effects are revealed, and the knowledge won’t detract from future viewing of the film. Included in this documentary are excerpts from “Star Wars” featuring Mark Hamill, Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher, Peter Cushing and Alec Guinness. Written by Richard Schickel and narrated by William Conrad.

results.title: The Making of a story: television news
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Compilation tape: 1.”The Making of a Story”. A documentary of how a story is evolved through the process of becoming television for the public. 2. “Television news”. A panel of four, representing professionals from the television networks, news departments as well as researches and academics, give some frameworks for those interested in studying television news. No other credits available.

results.title: The Making of a mural (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The work of Thomas Hart Benson, one of America’s modern painters, is studied in detail as he executes a 22 ft mural entitled “Achelous and Hercules” in a Kansas City women’s store. The process of making a mural is followed from the time of the artist’s original conception of the subject until the mural is completed on the walls.

results.title: The Making of a live television show
results.brief_description: Production of a live television show, from the first meeting of the writers to the dance rehearsal, to the final performance. Shows the pressure on the director and points out that a television presentation requires much pre-planning and work. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Making of a gallery
results.creator_credit: Patrick Ryan, Eltham Films and Tim Burstall
results.brief_description: This film recounts the early history of Victoria’s National Gallery, and illustrates the important role of the Felton Bequest, established in 1904, in laying the foundations for the gallery’s collection, and depicts some of the principal masterpieces. Finally Eric Westbrook, the gallery director, talks about the need for a new gallery, and architect Roy Grounds, discusses his aims in the design of the Arts Centre. Photographed by Nigel Buesst, music by George Dreyfus and written by Tim Burstall.

results.title: The Making of a documentary
results.brief_description: Television documentaries have long been a part of public service and information programs of major network and local TV stations. How such films are made is the engrossing subject of this film, using as an example the CBS News show, “The Catholic Dilemma”.

results.title: The Making of 'Sunday'
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Edwin Scragg and Scope Films
results.brief_description: The process of making a feature film, in this case, the South Australian Film Corporation’s award-winning first feature film “Sunday Too Far Away”, is the subject of this film. The problems and joys of film-making are revealed through interviews with director Ken Hannan and star Jack Thompson. The staging of a car crash is among the aspects of film-making included in this film.

results.title: The Making of 'Silent Running'
results.creator_credit: Chuck Barbee Productions, Chuck Barbee and Thomas Piskura
results.brief_description: Presents a behind-the-scenes look at the people and technology needed to produce the film “Silent running”. Gives a close look at the work of director Douglas Trumbull, star Bruce Dern, singer Joan Baez, the editor, cameraman and others. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Making of 'Raiders of the lost ark'
results.brief_description: Using many extracts from the film “Raiders of the lost ark”, and selections from seventy hours of production footage, this documentary covers key aspects of the production of the film, with special emphasis on Spielberg’s use of storyboards in conferences with his art and set designers, performers and crew. Includes interviews with stars Harrison Ford and Karen Allen, Spielberg and stuntman Harry Leonard. Phtographed and edited by Phillip Schuman and narrated by Scott Beach. Suitable for Years 7-12.

Includes interviews with stars Harrison Ford and Karen Allen, Spielberg and stuntman Harry Leonard. Phtographed and edited by Phillip Schuman and narrated by Scott Beach. Suitable for Years 7-12.

results.title: The Making of 'Orchestra!': Piano. The conductor
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Lewes, Declan Lowney and Initial (GB)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Orchestra!”.
This volume of the “Orchestra!” series explores the making of the series. It examines the role of the piano as a solo instrument within an orchestra and the role of the conductor from learning the score through interpretation, the metronome and rehearsal technique.
